thread.title: Manchester United star Paul Pogba and Chris Eubank Jr pose at Drake gig in Leeds with world champion’s super-middleweight belt
thread.title_full: Manchester United star Paul Pogba and Chris Eubank Jr pose at Drake gig in Leeds with world champion’s super-middleweight belt

author: ashilton
title: Manchester United star Paul Pogba and Chris Eubank Jr pose at Drake gig in Leeds with world champion’s super-middleweight belt
text:
Comments PAUL POGBA is closing on his own silverware this season. 
And the Manchester United ace got within touching distance of another title when he hooked up with Chris Eubank Jr last night. Instagram: chriseubankjr Paul Pogba poses with Chris Eubank Jr in Leeds 
Pogba’s United are in the EFL Cup final where they will be favourites to beat Southampton . 
Keep up to date with ALL the latest boxing news, gossip and rumours 
And he was spotted with Eubank Jr at a Drake gig in Leeds as part of the Canadian hip hop star’s global tour. 
Proud Eubank Jr was parading his belt after getting the better of Renold Quinlan on Saturday to rip the IBO world super-middleweight crown from Aussie. 
He was still sporting a shiner from the fight as he posed with Drake as well as fellow artists Young Thug and Kendrick Lamar. Instagram: chriseubankjr New world champ Eubank Jr with hip hip star Drake at his own gig Instagram: chriseubankjr 6 Eubank Jr with Young Thug and Kendrick Lamar 
Eubank Jr is plotting to make his first world title defence against American Daniel Jacobs – who beat cancer to become a ring star. 
The 27-year-old immediately laid out his intentions to take on the best in the business after his win over Quinlkan, calling out Gennady Golovkin, James DeGale and Billy Joe Saunders for big fights. 
But instead he is now likely to defend his crown for the first time against lesser-known Jacobs – who himself is next on the list for Golovkin. Getty Images 6 American fight Daniel Jacobs has been lined up as the next opponent for Chris Eubank Jr 
Jacobs and Golovkin clash on March 18, but no matter the result it has emerged that the American is now at the top of the list of the Eubank camp as the next opponent. 
The 29-year-old from Brooklyn has made a remarkable rise in the sport after being forced to take 18 months out while he fought cancer. 
Jacobs was hospitalised in New York while he battle to overcome osteosarcoma, a rare form of bone cancer. Getty Images Daniel Jacobs was out of boxing for 18 months while he fought cancer News Group Newspapers Ltd Chris Eubank Jr proved too strong for Australian Renold Quinlan Latest boxing news best boxing camp ever? David Haye prepares for Tony Bellew fight with sparring, basketball and drinks in the Jacuzzi on £27m Skyfall mega-yacht in Miami Fist class Joshua against Klitschko and Haye's clash with Bellew will carry on an explosive start to boxing in 2017 BROOK BEATEN Kell Brook agrees to Errol Spence fight with Amir Khan superfight on hold until later this year HE'S MY NO 1 Lennox Lewis says Tyson Fury is still the world's best heavyweight despite all his problems Squatch out Anthony Joshua steps up training ahead of Wembley battle with ex-heavyweight king Wladimir Klitschko Double Trouble Amir Khan trains with UFC star Nate Diaz at Andre Ward’s gym as talks continue over his next opponent dan the man Chris Eubank Jr lines up cancer survivor Daniel Jacobs for first world super-middleweight title defence HEAD SHOCK Boxing to get ringside brain scanners in bid to stop more tragedies after Mike Powell death 'TICKET TO THE BIG TIME' Chris Eubank Jnr calls out Gennady Golovkin, James DeGale and Billy Joe Saunders after world title win over Renold Quinlan 'We have unfinished business' Amir Khan wants rematch with Danny Garcia after Kell Brook fight fails to materialise stu-ing on it Stuart Hall's legal team write to IBF to request rematch after controversial defeat to Lee Haskins YOU BLUE IT Frank Bruno tries to help furious fans as ITV Box Office displays blue screen instead of Chris Eubank Jnr's pay-per-view boxing card 
But since his return to the ring in 2012 he has gone on to win his ten fights and changed his nickname from the Golden Child to Miracle Man. 
The former WBO middleweight champion has a record of 29 knockouts in his 32 victories with just one loss – a fifth round stoppage by Dimtry Pirog. 
And while all the hype is about going after Golovkin, Eubank is likely to play it safe as he gradually steps up in class by going for Jacons instead. Chris Eubank Jr wears his new IBO World Champion belt during hardcore training
